state_summary: Tayla Cannon, a physiotherapist turned entrepreneur, has developed Rebuildr, a HIPAA-compliant platform to help rehab professionals run their own businesses online. She received $1.1 million in seed funding from Slow Ventures.
evidence: Cannon started sharing her perspective online about 'proactive' and 'holistic' ways people can get rid of pain, which gained her over 130,000 followers on Instagram
She launched a platform called Athletic Rebuild, which provides rehab and performance coaching for athletes
Rebuildr is intended to be a 'complete shift from localized reactive care to a proactive, holistic mode', combining consumer solutions, clinicians, education, and software to deliver it all at scale
